newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling extends gains vs dlr on exporters.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling extends gains vs dlr on exporters.

text.p: The Kenyan shilling strengthened further against the dollar on Thursday as inflows from exporters continued to flow into the market, dealers said.
The Central Bank of Kenya posted a shilling mean rate of 56.77 against the dollar from 56.82 on Wednesday. On the pound, it was posted at an average of 88.00 from 87.97 on Wednesday.
"Activity in the local market was still high as inflows from exporters continued to trickle in unabated," a dealer said.
"Large inflows of hard currencies amid low importer demand pressured the dollar unit further down versus the shilling making it to 56.70/80 from 56.78.85 in early trade," she said.

Dealers said overnight money market rates moved up to between 15 and 22 percent. They said market liquidity was concentrated between a few banks. As a result, those banks appeared to be dictating the rates, dealers said.
